snippet: Three of the biggest sprinters in track and field, including the American Tyson Gay, on Sunday revealed that they had tested positive for banned substances.
abstract: Three of top sprinters in track and field, including American Tyson Gay, reveal that they have tested positive for banned substances, new embarrassment for sport that has had dozens of doping violations in recent years; Gay, an American, withdraws himself from world championships and pledges complete openness with officials.

byline.contributor: Jeré Longman and Juliet Macur contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Three of the biggest sprinters in track and field, including the American Tyson Gay, on Sunday revealed that they had tested positive for banned substances.

headline.main: Top Sprinters Test Positive, Jolting Track World
headline.print_headline: Top Sprinters Test Positive, Jolting Track World
